doc.after: In the Balkans, up to 581,000 Yugoslav civilians were killed during World War II in Yugoslavia.[363][364] German forces, under express orders from Hitler, fought with a special vengeance against the Serbs, who were considered Untermenschen (sub-humans).[365] The UstaÅ¡e collaborators conducted a systematic extermination of large numbers of people for political, religious or racial reasons. The most numerous victims were Serbs.
